intro: Brickellia hartwegii, commonly known as Hartweg's brickellia, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a perennial shrub characterized by its yellow-orange flowers and hairy stems. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in arid or semi-arid environments. Its leaves are narrow and often covered with fine hairs, which help reduce water loss. Brickellia hartwegii is part of the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is known for its ecological importance to local pollinators.
